intro: Gonostemon grandiflorus var. fergusoniae, commonly known as the Fergusoniae gonostemon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
